data.event: It was platted in 1812 and according to WPA records was presumably named for Bethlehem, Pennsylvania.
Its first office was established on March 6, 1816.

event.title: was destroyed by the Ohio River flood of 1937

data.event: Much of Bethlehem's history was destroyed by the Ohio River flood of 1937.
The first settlers arrived at the site in 1805 Armstrong and others, most notably Jonathon Clark and William Plaskett, platted the community in 1812.
